product_name: Start Your Lawn from Scratch Kit
description:
Laying the foundations for your lush lawn

Grow a resilient, green lawn with our comprehensive tall fescue kit.

The Start Your Lawn from Scratch Kit is meticulously designed for starting new lawns—featuring Fescue Rescue Grass Seed for deep green color, fast growth, and resilience, Lawn Starter for robust seedling development, Iron Boost for rapid greening, and Lawn Aid to protect new grass.

Grow greener, healthier lawns right from the start with Sunday's sustainable lawn care solutions.

sections.kit_benefits:
Robust lawn establishment with durable, disease-resistant tall fescue grass, ideal for cool-season climates
Comprehensive lawn nutrition fertilizers enriched with nitrogen, phosphorus, and iron for deep roots, rapid growth, and vibrant greening
Made for cool-season lawns in northern and transitional climates
Eco-conscious and user-friendly products for easier lawn care
Coverage up to 1,250 sq. ft., perfect for small to medium-sized lawns
sections.whats_included:
Fescue Rescue Grass Seed: Fast-growing, drought-tolerant seed
Lawn Starter Fertilizer: Enhances seedling growth and rooting
Iron Boost: Rapid growth and greening
Lawn Aid Treatment: Protects new grass from heat stress
sections.instructions:
For best results, apply early morning or evening, and make sure your lawn is adequately hydrated. Avoid use on drought-affected or heat-stressed lawns.
Lightly prep lawn for new seed with light raking or tilling.
Spread Fescue Rescue Grass Seed according to the recommended rate evenly across the lawn.
Water daily until seedlings sprout, then switch to a normal watering schedule of 1-3x weekly.
Once ~60% of seedlings emerge, apply Lawn Starter to encourage seedling and root development.
After 4-6 weeks, apply Iron Boost to boost growth.
Once grass is established, and before the summer heat, apply Lawn Aid to protect new grass.
Save sprayers for later use. If you have any leftover product, apply every 4-6 weeks until the pouches are emptied.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
When is the best time to apply fertilizer to my lawn?
For optimal results, fertilize your lawn when grass is actively growing and at least 60% of new grass begins to fill in. Apply early in the morning or the evening when temperatures are between 50 to 85 degrees F to a well-hydrated lawn.
When is the best time to apply grass seed?
The best time to plant Fescue Rescue is in early spring or fall when air and soil temperatures are moderate, between 55-75 degrees F.
How do I plant grass seed?
Prepare the soil, by lighting tilling, or raking.
Evenly distribute the seed, using a hand or push spreader for uniform coverage.
Keep the area moist until at least 60% of the seed germinates.
Introduce a 1-3x weekly regular watering schedule and mow when grass reaches 4-6 inches.
How often should I use the products?
Seed in spring or fall. Apply fertilizers every 4-6 weeks in the growing season. Use Lawn Aid before the peak summer heat and after high heat to assist lawn recovery.
How do I use it with other Sunday products?
After seeding and fertilization, allow the lawn to dry before using any other Sunday products. Pair this kit with Sunday weed control for a comprehensive lawn care regimen, promoting healthy growth and reducing weeds.
How to Apply Sunday Products in Order
Maximize your yard's potential with Sunday lawn care products. Apply in the correct order for the best results, ensuring a lush, thriving lawn and yard.
